metadata.title: CVE-2016-1285 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P4 and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P4 does notproperly handle DNAME records when parsing fetch reply messages, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure anddaemon exit) via a malformed packet to the rndc (aka control channel)interface, related to alist.c and sexpr.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.8').
